page.title: 17Houses in Cliffe
page.content: Nearly all the houses in the area are privately owned. There were 22 {Council houses}in Cliffe, 10 in Chapelfields on York Road, and 12 in Curson Terrace along Oxen Lane, but some people have bought their houses from the Council. There are six council houses in South Duffield, and none in the part of Osgodby covered by the survey. Houses are built of brick, some modern ones have stone for ornament. Roofs are tiles or slates. Almost all the{private houses}are detatched, in Osgodby there are a lot of bungalows. There are hardly any old houses, and the ones that are left have been modernised. All the houses have gardens and most have garages. Nearly all have central heating, worked from coal or oil because there is no gas.
